title: Provides for the establishment of a New York city liquor authority to license and regulate the retail alcoholic beverage business in the city
summary: Provides for the establishment of a New York city liquor authority to license and regulate the retail alcoholic beverage business in the city; provides for its functions, powers, and duties; places limits on conflicts of interest.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

                                         1042

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011

       Introduced  by M. of A. PHEFFER, MARKEY, DINOWITZ, GOTTFRIED, LANCMAN --
         Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. BRENNAN, CLARK, COLTON,  COOK,  JACOBS,
         MAYERSOHN,  MILLMAN, ROSENTHAL, TOWNS -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Economic Development, Job Creation, Commerce and Industry

       AN ACT to amend the alcoholic  beverage  control  law,  in  relation  to
         authorizing the creation of an alcoholic beverage control board in and
         by the city of New York

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Declaration of legislative findings and intent. The  legis-
    2  lature  hereby  finds,  determines  and  declares that it is a matter of
    3  state concern and in the interest of the people of the state to  author-
    4  ize  the  establishment of a city liquor authority in and by the city of
    5  New York. The need for self-regulation of the sale of alcoholic beverag-
    6  es by the city of New York is well documented. There are too many estab-
    7  lishments in close proximity to each other that engage in  the  sale  of
    8  alcoholic beverages. This has resulted in an increase in noise, traffic,
    9  litter,  and criminal activities, especially late at night.  Consequent-
   10  ly, the quality of life in neighborhoods within the city of New York has
   11  deteriorated. Therefore, the legislature finds  and  declares  that  the
   12  creation of a city liquor authority would enable the city of New York to
   13  more  effectively  and  efficiently  monitor  these  establishments  and
   14  enforce the alcoholic beverage  control  law.  The  legislature  further
   15  finds  and  declares  that  the creation of a city liquor authority will
   16  help improve the quality of life in the city of  New  York  as  well  as
   17  insure compliance with other applicable laws.
   18    It is the intent of the legislature to hereby authorize the establish-
   19  ment  of a city liquor authority in and by the city of New York in order
   20  to provide proper and adequate enforcement  of  the  alcoholic  beverage
   21  control law.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00377-01-1

       A. 1042                             2

    1    S  2.  The  alcoholic  beverage control law is amended by adding a new
    2  article 3 to read as follows:
    3                                   ARTICLE 3
    4                       NEW YORK CITY LIQUOR AUTHORITY
    5  SECTION 30. DEFINITIONS.
    6          31. AUTHORITY; COMMISSIONER.
    7          32. DEPUTIES.
    8          33. OFFICERS; EMPLOYEES; OFFICES.
    9          34. DISQUALIFICATION   OF  COMMISSIONER  AND  EMPLOYEES  OF  THE
   10                AUTHORITY.
   11          35. FUNCTIONS, POWERS, AND DUTIES OF THE AUTHORITY.
   12          36. NOTICE TO COMMUNITY BOARDS.
   13          37. POWERS AND DUTIES OF THE COMMISSIONER.
   14          38. NECESSARY PARTY.
   15    S 30. DEFINITIONS. AS USED IN THIS ARTICLE:
   16    1. "AUTHORITY" SHALL MEAN THE NEW YORK CITY LIQUOR AUTHORITY.
   17    2. "COMMISSIONER" SHALL MEAN THE COMMISSIONER OF  THE  NEW  YORK  CITY
   18  LIQUOR AUTHORITY.
   19    S  31. AUTHORITY; COMMISSIONER. THE CITY OF NEW YORK IS HEREBY AUTHOR-
   20  IZED TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN AN AUTHORITY  TO  REGULATE  THE  SALE  OF
   21  ALCOHOLIC  BEVERAGES  WITHIN ITS JURISDICTION AND ENFORCE LAWS AND REGU-
   22  LATIONS THEREFOR, THE HEAD OF WHICH SHALL BE THE COMMISSIONER.
   23    S 32. DEPUTIES. THE COMMISSIONER MAY APPOINT THREE  DEPUTIES,  ONE  OF
   24  WHOM  MAY  PERFORM  ALL  DUTIES  AND  EXERCISE  ALL OF THE POWERS OF THE
   25  COMMISSIONER WHEN SO AUTHORIZED BY INSTRUMENT IN WRITING TO BE FILED  IN
   26  THE OFFICES OF THE MAYOR AND THE COMPTROLLER OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK.
   27    S 33. OFFICERS; EMPLOYEES; OFFICES. THE AUTHORITY SHALL HAVE THE POWER
   28  TO  APPOINT  ANY  NECESSARY COUNSELS, ASSISTANTS, INVESTIGATORS, HEARING
   29  OFFICERS, AND OTHER EMPLOYEES. INVESTIGATORS SO EMPLOYED BY THE AUTHORI-
   30  TY SHALL BE DEEMED TO BE PEACE OFFICERS FOR THE PURPOSE OF ENFORCING THE
   31  PROVISIONS OF THIS CHAPTER OR JUDGMENTS OR ORDERS OBTAINED FOR VIOLATION
   32  THEREOF, WITH ALL THE POWERS SET FORTH IN SECTION 2.20 OF  THE  CRIMINAL
   33  PROCEDURE  LAW. THE COUNSEL, SECRETARY, CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, COMMIS-
   34  SIONERS, AND DEPUTIES SHALL BE IN THE EXEMPT CLASS OF THE CIVIL SERVICE.
   35  THE OTHER ASSISTANTS, HEARING OFFICERS, INVESTIGATORS, AND EMPLOYEES  OF
   36  THE  AUTHORITY  SHALL  ALL  BE  IN  THE  COMPETITIVE  CLASS OF THE CIVIL
   37  SERVICE.
   38    S 34. DISQUALIFICATION OF COMMISSIONER AND EMPLOYEES OF THE AUTHORITY.
   39  NO COMMISSIONER OF THE AUTHORITY OR ANY OFFICER, DEPUTY,  HEARING  OFFI-
   40  CER,  ASSISTANT,  INSPECTOR, OR EMPLOYEE THEREOF SHALL HAVE AN INTEREST,
   41  DIRECT OR INDIRECT, EITHER PROPRIETARY OR BY MEANS OF ANY LOAN, MORTGAGE
   42  OR LIEN, OR IN ANY OTHER MANNER, IN ANY PREMISES WHERE ALCOHOLIC  BEVER-
   43  AGES  ARE  MANUFACTURED  OR SOLD; NOR SHALL HAVE ANY INTEREST, DIRECT OR
   44  INDIRECT, IN ANY BUSINESS WHOLLY OR PARTIALLY DEVOTED  TO  THE  MANUFAC-
   45  TURE,  SALE,  TRANSPORTATION,  OR STORAGE OF ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES, OR OWN
   46  ANY STOCK IN ANY CORPORATION WHICH  HAS  ANY  INTEREST,  PROPRIETARY  OR
   47  OTHERWISE, DIRECT OR INDIRECT, IN ANY PREMISES WHERE ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES
   48  ARE MANUFACTURED OR SOLD, OR IN ANY BUSINESS WHOLLY OR PARTIALLY DEVOTED
   49  TO  THE MANUFACTURE, SALE, TRANSPORTATION OR STORAGE OF ALCOHOLIC BEVER-
   50  AGES, OR RECEIVE ANY PROFIT WHATSOEVER, DIRECT  OR  INDIRECT,  FROM  ANY
   51  PERSON  APPLYING  FOR OR RECEIVING ANY LICENSE OR PERMIT PROVIDED FOR IN
   52  THIS CHAPTER, OR HOLD ANY OTHER PUBLIC OFFICE IN  THE  CITY  OR  IN  ANY
   53  POLITICAL  SUBDIVISION,  EXCEPT  UPON WRITTEN PERMISSION OF THE NEW YORK
   54  CITY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST BOARD.
   55    S 35. FUNCTIONS, POWERS, AND DUTIES OF THE  AUTHORITY.  THE  AUTHORITY
   56  SHALL HAVE THE FOLLOWING FUNCTIONS, POWERS, AND DUTIES:

       A. 1042                             3

    1    1.  TO  ISSUE OR REFUSE TO ISSUE ANY LICENSE OR PERMIT FOR THE SALE OF
    2  ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES AT RETAIL.
    3    2.  TO  LIMIT, IN ITS DISCRETION, THE NUMBER OF LICENSES OF EACH CLASS
    4  TO BE ISSUED WITHIN THE CITY OR ANY POLITICAL SUBDIVISION  THEREOF  AND,
    5  IN  CONNECTION THEREWITH, TO PROHIBIT THE ACCEPTANCE OF APPLICATIONS FOR
    6  SUCH CLASS OR CLASSES OF LICENSES WHICH HAVE BEEN SO LIMITED.
    7    3. TO REVOKE, CANCEL, OR SUSPEND  FOR  CAUSE  ANY  LICENSE  OR  PERMIT
    8  ISSUED  PURSUANT TO THIS CHAPTER AND/OR IMPOSE A CIVIL PENALTY FOR CAUSE
    9  AGAINST ANY HOLDER OF A LICENSE OR PERMIT ISSUED PURSUANT TO THIS  CHAP-
   10  TER.
   11    4.  TO  REMOVE  ANY  EMPLOYEE  FOR  CAUSE,  CONSISTENT WITH APPLICABLE
   12  COLLECTIVE BARGAINING AGREEMENTS OR LOCAL AND STATE LAWS,  AFTER  GIVING
   13  SUCH  EMPLOYEE A COPY OF THE CHARGES AGAINST HIM OR HER, IN WRITING, AND
   14  AN OPPORTUNITY TO BE HEARD THEREON.
   15    5. TO HOLD HEARINGS,  SUBPOENA  WITNESSES,  COMPEL  THEIR  ATTENDANCE,
   16  ADMINISTER  OATHS,  AND  TO EXAMINE ANY PERSON UNDER OATH IN RELATION TO
   17  ANY MATTERS, DETERMINATIONS, OR PROCEEDINGS PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION.  A
   18  SUBPOENA ISSUED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL BE REGULATED BY THE CIVIL
   19  PRACTICE LAW AND RULES.
   20    6.  TO  MAKE AN ANNUAL REPORT TO THE MAYOR, THE CITY COUNCIL, AND EACH
   21  BOROUGH PRESIDENT OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK  OF  ITS  ACTIVITIES  FOR  THE
   22  PRECEDING YEAR.
   23    7.  TO  APPOINT SUCH ADVISORY GROUPS AND COMMITTEES AS IT DEEMS NECES-
   24  SARY TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE AUTHORITY TO CARRY  OUT  THE  PURPOSES
   25  AND OBJECTIVES OF THIS CHAPTER.
   26    8.  UPON RECEIPT OF A RESOLUTION ADOPTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF
   27  NEW YORK REQUESTING FURTHER RESTRICTION OF HOURS OF  SALE  OF  ALCOHOLIC
   28  BEVERAGES  WITHIN SUCH CITY, AND UPON NOTICE AND HEARING WITHIN THE CITY
   29  OF NEW YORK, TO APPROVE OR DISAPPROVE SUCH HOURS WITHIN THE CITY OF  NEW
   30  YORK.
   31    9.  THE  AUTHORITY  SHALL  EXERCISE  ITS POWERS AND DUTIES IN A MANNER
   32  CONSISTENT WITH ALL APPLICABLE LAWS.
   33    S 36. NOTICE TO COMMUNITY BOARDS. AMONG  OTHER  INFORMATION  THAT  THE
   34  AUTHORITY  SHALL  CONSIDER IN GRANTING OR REVOKING LICENSES, WHICH SHALL
   35  BE DETAILED IN THE RULES AND REGULATIONS PROMULGATED PURSUANT TO  SUBDI-
   36  VISION  SEVEN  OF  SECTION  THIRTY-SEVEN  OF THIS ARTICLE, THE AUTHORITY
   37  SHALL NOTIFY LOCAL COMMUNITY BOARDS OF ANY PENDING ACTIONS, HEARINGS, OR
   38  DETERMINATIONS WITHIN OR AFFECTING AREAS WITHIN SUCH  COMMUNITY  BOARD'S
   39  JURISDICTION. SUCH NOTICE SHALL BE MADE IN WRITING AT LEAST FIFTEEN DAYS
   40  PRIOR  TO SUCH ACTION, HEARING, OR DETERMINATION. RESPONSES SUBMITTED BY
   41  THE AFFECTED COMMUNITY BOARD SHALL BE CONSIDERED BY THE AUTHORITY  WHERE
   42  APPLICABLE.
   43    S  37.  POWERS  AND DUTIES OF THE COMMISSIONER. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL
   44  HAVE THE FOLLOWING FUNCTIONS, POWERS AND DUTIES:
   45    1. TO EXERCISE THE POWERS AND PERFORM THE DUTIES IN  RELATION  TO  THE
   46  ADMINISTRATION OF THE AUTHORITY.
   47    2. TO PERFORM THE ADMINISTRATIVE FUNCTIONS OF THE AUTHORITY.
   48    3.  TO  KEEP  RECORDS  IN  SUCH FORM AS HE OR SHE MAY PRESCRIBE OF ALL
   49  LICENSES AND PERMITS ISSUED AND REVOKED WITHIN THE  CITY  OF  NEW  YORK;
   50  SUCH  RECORDS SHALL BE SO KEPT AS TO PROVIDE READY INFORMATION AS TO THE
   51  IDENTITY OF ALL LICENSEES, INCLUDING  THE  NAMES  OF  THE  OFFICERS  AND
   52  DIRECTORS  OF CORPORATE LICENSEES AND THE LOCATION OF ALL LICENSED PREM-
   53  ISES.
   54    4. TO INSPECT OR PROVIDE FOR THE  INSPECTION  OF  ANY  PREMISES  WHERE
   55  ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES ARE MANUFACTURED OR SOLD.

       A. 1042                             4

    1    5.  TO  PRESCRIBE FORMS OF APPLICATIONS FOR LICENSES AND PERMITS UNDER
    2  THIS CHAPTER AND OF ALL REPORTS DEEMED NECESSARY BY THE AUTHORITY.
    3    6.  TO DELEGATE TO THE OFFICERS AND EMPLOYEES OF THE AUTHORITY SUCH OF
    4  HIS OR HER POWERS AND DUTIES AS HE OR SHE MAY DETERMINE.
    5    7. TO FORMULATE, ADOPT, PROMULGATE, AND ENFORCE, PURSUANT TO THE  CITY
    6  ADMINISTRATIVE  PROCEDURE  ACT, COMPLETE RULES, REGULATIONS, ORDERS, AND
    7  DIRECTIONS FOR THE SECURITY OF LIFE AND HEALTH IN THE CITY, WHICH  SHALL
    8  NOT BE INCONSISTENT WITH THE STATE'S ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE CONTROL LAWS.
    9    S  38.  NECESSARY PARTY. THE AUTHORITY SHALL BE A PARTY TO ALL ACTIONS
   10  AND PROCEEDINGS AFFECTING IN ANY MANNER THE ISSUANCE  OR  REVOCATION  OF
   11  LICENSES TO RETAILERS AND TO ALL INJUNCTION PROCEEDINGS AGAINST LICENSED
   12  RETAILERS WITHIN ITS JURISDICTION.
   13    S  3. This act shall take effect on the first of January next succeed-
   14  ing the date on which it shall have become a law and shall apply to  all
   15  licenses  issued,  renewed, modified, or altered on or after such effec-
   16  tive date.
